sentences.en: A 40 watt bulb would be quite sufficient and would not obtrude.
sentences.cn: 40瓦的灯泡完全够亮了，并且不会晃眼。

sentences.en: A certain gasoline camping lantern emits as much light as a 25 - watt electric light bulb.
sentences.cn: 某汽油野营灯,与25w的电灯泡发光相同.

sentences.en: Excuse me. May I see Mr. John Watt, the manager?
sentences.cn: 劳驾,请问我能见经理约翰. 瓦特先生 吗 ?

sentences.en: George sent the cheque to Watt.
sentences.cn: 乔治把支票给瓦特寄去了.

sentences.en: Real solution is the James Watt steam engine ship.
sentences.cn: 真正解决船用蒸汽机的是詹姆斯·瓦特.

sentences.en: So in 1774 Watt moved to Birmingham, and the next year he and Boulton became partners.
sentences.cn: 因此,瓦特于1774年搬到伯明翰.次年,他和波尔顿成为合作伙伴.

sentences.en: State of California v. Watt, 712 F .2 d 584 ( D . C . Cir. 1983 ).
sentences.cn: 参见“加利福尼亚诉瓦特”[1983年《联邦判例汇编》第2集第712卷第584页 ( 地区法院巡回法庭 ) ].

sentences.en: The dim yellow light of the fifteen - watt bulb flickered overhead.
sentences.cn: 十五支光电灯的黄光在他们头上晃着.

sentences.en: The invention of the engine is creditable to Watt.
sentences.cn: 发动机的发明归功于瓦特.

sentences.en: The unit of power is watt.
Watt inaugurated the age of steam.
Watt's engine also used hot steam , not cold air, to force down the piston.
sentences.cn: 瓦特的发动机也是利用热空气而不是冷空气带动活塞.

sentences.en: With an 18-watt fluorescent bulb you get as much light but use 75% less electricity.
sentences.cn: 用18瓦的荧光灯灯泡有同样的亮度，而用电量却减少75％。

trans.tran_en: a unit for measuring electrical power
